children.label: biochemical trait
children.Name: biochemical trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a quality of a chemical entity (CHEBI:24431), a plant metabolite (CHEBI:76924), or a molecular function (GO:0003674), which occurs in a cellular component (GO:0005575), plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or during a plant structure development stage (PO:0009012).

children.label: biological process trait
children.Name: biological process trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a process quality (PATO:0001236) of a biological process (GO:0008150) which occurs in a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131), a cellular component (GO:0005575), or during a plant structure development stage (PO:0009012).

children.label: plant growth and development trait
children.Name: plant growth and development trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is the growth (GO:0048590) and development (GO:0032502) of a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or a constituent cellular component (GO:0005575).

children.label: plant morphology trait
children.Name: plant morphology trait
children.Synonyms: plant structure trait | plant architecture trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a morphological quality of a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or a constituent cellular component (GO:0005575) contained therein.

children.label: plant quality trait
children.Name: plant quality trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) that contributes to the overall utility, nutritional, or economic value of a plant, plant structure (PO:0009011) or plant product.

children.label: plant vigor trait
children.Name: plant vigor trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a measure of the active and/or healthy growth and development of a plant stucture (PO:0009011) or a population of plants.

children.label: sterility or fertility trait
children.Name: sterility or fertility trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a measure of either the fertility or sterility, contributed by nonfunctional male and or female plant parts or their incompatible interaction. This also includes traits on seed setting behavior in the fruit (caryopsis) of a grass plant that can be assayed in terms of spikelet sterility or fertility.

children.label: stress trait
children.Name: stress trait
children.Synonyms: stress susceptibility | stress resistance | crop damage | stress tolerance
children.Definitions: Response by the plant in terms of resistivity or sensitivity to either the biotic or the abiotic types of stress.

children.label: yield trait
children.Name: yield trait
children.Definitions: A plant trait (TO:0000387) which is a harvestable product that is a plant anatomical entity (PO:0025131) or one or more constituent cellular components (GO:0005575) contained therein.

children.label: animal welfare trait
children.Name: animal welfare trait
children.Definitions: any measurable or observable characteristic related to the state of mental and physical health in which an animal is in harmony with its environment and as regards to its attempts to cope with its.

children.label: growth and meat production trait
children.Name: growth and meat production trait
children.Definitions: any measurable or observable characteristics related to animal growth and meat production quantity and quality.

children.label: mammary gland and milk production trait
children.Name: mammary gland and milk production trait
children.Definitions: any measurable or observable characteristic related to the mammary gland and milk production trait.

children.label: nutrition trait
children.Name: nutrition trait
children.Definitions: any measurable or observable chararcteristic related to the set of functions by which the animal transforms feeds in nutrients and uses these latter for its maintenance and production.

children.label: reproduction trait
children.Name: reproduction trait
children.Definitions: any measurable or observable characteristic of the organs associated with producing offspring.
